IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: THE COLLEGE'S MISSION IS TO PROVIDE EDUCATION IN FINE ARTS
IRS990.MissionDescription: THE COLLEGE'S MISSION IS TO PROVIDE EDUCATION IN FINE ARTS
IRS990.Description: Instruction - Primary mission. The College is a private institution offering bachelor and master of fine arts degree programs to approximately 300 full-time students concentrating in the fine arts, a post-baccalaureate program in art education, as well as a wide range of professional institutes and continuing studies classes for individuals of all ages and a publicly accessible gallery, the Institute of Contemporary Art.

OtherLiabilities.Description: Due to federal govt - Perkins Loan Fund

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Part XIII, Line 4b: Other revenue amounts included on 990 but not included in F/S
Part XIII, Line 2d: Other expenses and losses per audited F/S
Part XII, Line 4b: Other revenue amounts included on 990 but not included in F/S
Part XI, Line 8: Other Changes in Net Assets or Fund Balances
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Unrealized loss on investment $ -0 Loss on extinguishment of debt $ -272849

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Part III, Line 1a: If organization elected under SFAS 116 to not report are, historical treasures, o
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The College does not capitalize collections, primarily library books and art objects, as they are held for public exhibition and education rather than financial gain. Any proceeds from the sale of collection items are used to acquire other items for the collection. The College estimates the value of the collection to be approximately $91,000 at June 30, 2010.

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: The nondiscriminatory policy is listed in the Student Handbook, the College recruitment View Book, and on the College's web site.
IRS990ScheduleE.GovtFinancialAidExplanation: The organization receives funds from various programs of the United States Department of Education, such as the Federal Perkins Loan Program, the Federal Work Study Program, and the Federal Pell Program. These funds allow the College to help students to finance the cost of their education.

Form990ScheduleKPartI.DescriptionOfPurpose: Purchase and renovation of residence hall.

Form990ScheduleMPartII.Identifier: Part I, Line 33, Revenues Not Reported
Form990ScheduleMPartII.Explanation: GIFTS OF BOOKS AND PUBLICATIONS ARE ACKNOWLEDGED BUT NOT VALUED

Form990ScheduleMPartII.Identifier: Part I, Line 32, Hire and Use of Third Parties
Form990ScheduleMPartII.Explanation: THE ART GIFTS ARE SOLD AT AUCTION BY A THIRD PARTY VOLUNTEER AUCTIONEER. OUR INVESTMENT ADVISOR SELLS STOCK GIFTS AT MARKET PRICE

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The College makes its governing documents and financial statements available to the public upon request.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b: Compensation Review and Approval Process for Officers and Key Employees
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The President's or CEO's compensation is determined by the Executive Committee of the Board of Trustees. They conduct a review of the President annually, review the salary survey made available by the Association of Independent Colleges of Art and Design (AICAD) as a resource in determining the level of compensation and review and update his employment contract.The President determines the compensation for the Officers of the College. She/he conducts an annual review of each Officer or Vice President and reviews the salary survey made available by the Association of Independent Colleges of Art and Design (AICAD) as a resource in determining levels of compensation.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11: Form 990 Review Process
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Board Chair, Finance Committee, and management review the 990 prior to submission
